com.esri.mo2.map.mem
Class MemoryLayerSource

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayerSource
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseWorkspaceLayerSource
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.map.mem.MemoryLayerSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
LayerSource, WorkspaceLayerSource
Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, see Content API.

public class MemoryLayerSource
extends BaseWorkspaceLayerSource

This LayerSource provides a way to create one or more FeatureLayers that are each associated with MemoryFeatureClass. These Layers can be used to display data that is kept in-memory or can be associated with custom datasets.

In order to use this LayerSource, you first need to construct one or more FeatureClasses that you want to work with. In order to do this, you can use one of the addFeatureClass methods to construct a MemoryFeatureClass for you, by supplying just the name, feature type, and Fields collection. Alternatively, you can construct your own custom MemoryFeatureClass and use the other addFeatureClass method to add your custom MemoryFeatureClass to this LayerSource.

Once you have constructed the MemoryFeatureClass, you can obtain it using getFeatureClass in order to manage Features. You can also obtain Layers that represent these MemoryFeatureClasses by using the regular LayerSource methods for doing this.

Note: This is the only LayerSource that isn't cached. Therefore you can construct a MemoryLayerSource without calling the static method - getLayerSource. This makes it possible to subclass the MemoryLayerSource to add functionality.

Method Detail

addFeatureClass

public void addFeatureClass(String name,
                            int ft,
                            Fields fields)
Deprecated. 
Constructs a new MemoryFeatureClass with the given name, feature type and field collection, then adds it to this MemoryLayerSource. If a featureclass with the same name is already kept in this MemoryLayerSource, then the existing featureclass will be replaced. Use the getFeatureClass method to check for a pre-existing MemoryFeatureClass if this is necessary.

Parameters:
name - the name of the new MemoryFeatureClass
ft - the feature type
fields - the Field collection
See Also:
MemoryFeatureClass
